creator: ragaller@apache.org
text:
suggestion:
- recommended screen width: 1024 (exception system overview in admin tab)
-
support for: >= ie 6, safari 2, firefox 2
- hacks for ie6 go in separate stylesheet

known
problems:
- collapsing of admin area divs inside #leny-cmsbody @ small screen width
-
collapsing of the admin menu @ small screen width
- long names overlap the site tree widget's
canvas
- site tree language tab collapse @ small screen width

Created attachment 21148
[PATCH] tabs.css

This patch fixes some of the collapsing problems.

It uses fixed widths for the
(left-)floating admin divs. And left margins for the divs at the right side.
The gui is changed a bit (bigger canvas of the (non-floating) boxes on the
right side) - the patch is meant for discussion.

Comments are welcome.
creator: ragaller@apache.org

creator: andreas@apache.org
ragaller@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
Agree - I think it's a compromise between usability and screen space consumption. I'll put it to 11px.

(In reply to comment #3)
Yeah that's an advantage of fully floating tabs - but I could not find a working solution for (3 in a row) floating divs without the collapsing effect at small screen sizes. There is room for improvement - I think the div width can be reduced (to maybe 160 or 180px for the left tabs menu).

Maybe there is a more elegant solution for 2.0.1 (but that might involve some structural changes in xhtml as well - currently it does not validate).

creator: ragaller@apache.org
text:
I think the screen space can be optimized (see new patch)
Currently I'm having the following issue:

The lenya admin gui sports a table with (sometimes) a single cell. The width of the table (class="lenya-body") is set to 100%. Non floating divs consume the full available width. 

In the tabbed admin section I'd like to get rid of the 100% width rule. But this affects the login/logout screens.

I'll submit a reworked patch that shows the effect. An ie 5 specific stylesheet is in the works.

Again - comments are welcome.
